meanings.definition: Admit that something is true or valid after first denying or resisting it.
meanings.sent1: She finally conceded that she was wrong.
meanings.sent2: He conceded defeat after realizing his mistake.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn cat conceded that the laser pointer was not a threat.
meanings.sent4: The sun conceded its brightness to the moon's gentle glow.
meanings.sent5: After much debate, he conceded to her superior argument.

meanings.sent1: The army conceded the territory to the enemy.
meanings.sent2: She conceded her seat to the elderly lady on the bus.
meanings.sent3: The child playfully conceded his toy to his friend.
meanings.sent4: The tree conceded its leaves to the autumn breeze.
meanings.sent5: In the game of chess, he conceded his queen to save his king.

meanings.sent1: He conceded his favorite book to his sister.
meanings.sent2: The company conceded control of the project to a more experienced team.
meanings.sent3: The magician theatrically conceded his wand to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The river conceded its banks to the floodwaters.
meanings.sent5: She tearfully conceded her childhood home to the new owners.
